message.content:
To calculate ROA, we first compute the average total assets and then divide the net profit by this average.

Step 1. Identify the values:
• Initial total assets = 13,000,000.00  
• End total assets = 15,086,049.65  
• Net Profit = –1,342,040.76 (from the income statement)

Step 2. Calculate the average total assets:
  Average Total Assets = (Initial Total Assets + End Total Assets) / 2  
  = (13,000,000.00 + 15,086,049.65) / 2  
  = 28,086,049.65 / 2  
  = 14,043,024.825

Step 3. Calculate the Return on Assets (ROA):
  ROA = (Net Profit / Average Total Assets) × 100  
  = (–1,342,040.76 / 14,043,024.825) × 100  
  ≈ –9.55%

Thus, the ROA is approximately –9.55%.

The solution in the required JSON format is:
{
  "solution": {
    "Return on Assets (ROA)": "-9.55%"
  }
}
